howPerformed[TOK_Q_DELIM]A section of ti.query: prop=howPerformed, value=A section of tissue is removed from the diseased or injured cornea using either a surgical cutting instrument called a trephine or a femtosecond laser. The surgeon then sutures donor tissue into place., parent_class=MedicalProcedure

disambiguatingDescription[TOK_Q_DELIM]In.query: prop=disambiguatingDescription, value=Intacs® are corneal implants are FDA-approved for treatment of keratoconus, myopia, astigmatism, and other eye conditions, reducing or eliminating the need for glasses or contact lens. , parent_class=MedicalProcedure

disambiguatingDescription[TOK_Q_DELIM]A.query: prop=disambiguatingDescription, value=A laser creates a pocket in the first few layers of the cornea and then the lens is placed in the pocket and centered over the pupil. Only one eye is treated.	The KAMRA® Inlay treats blurry near vision, a common condition called presbyopia, for patie, parent_class=MedicalProcedure

howPerformed[TOK_Q_DELIM]The surgeon cre.query: prop=howPerformed, value=The surgeon creates a tunnel between layers of the corneal stroma and inserts thin, disc-shaped implants to flatten the cornea., parent_class=MedicalProcedure

disambiguatingDescription[TOK_Q_DELIM]Vi.query: prop=disambiguatingDescription, value=Visian ICL™ is an implantable, biocompatible lens that corrects moderate to high nearsightedness for patients who don\'t want to wear contact lenses or eyeglasses., parent_class=MedicalProcedure

disambiguatingDescription[TOK_Q_DELIM]Ph.query: prop=disambiguatingDescription, value=Photorefractive Keratectomy (PRK), is a precise, minimally invasive method of reshaping the cornea. This helps the eye to focus properly, thus reducing or eliminating the need for eyeglasses and contact lenses. , parent_class=MedicalProcedure

disambiguatingDescription[TOK_Q_DELIM]La.query: prop=disambiguatingDescription, value=Laser cataract surgery involves using a laser to remove cataracts and usually replace the clouded lens with a clear, artificial lens. Not every cataract surgery includes implanting an artificial lens. , parent_class=MedicalProcedure

howPerformed[TOK_Q_DELIM]An eye doctor r.query: prop=howPerformed, value=An eye doctor replaces a clear lens and replaces it with an artificial intraocular lens (IOL) to correct for age-related vision issues., parent_class=MedicalProcedure

howPerformed[TOK_Q_DELIM]The thin, top l.query: prop=howPerformed, value=The thin, top layer of the cornea known as epithelium is gently removed. The excimer laser is then used to reshape the cornea., parent_class=MedicalProcedure

howPerformed[TOK_Q_DELIM]A thin flap in.query: prop=howPerformed, value=A thin flap in the cornea is created using either a microkeratome blade or a femtosecond laser. The surgeon folds back the flap, then removes some corneal tissue underneath using an excimer laser., parent_class=MedicalProcedure

howPerformed[TOK_Q_DELIM]After applying.query: prop=howPerformed, value=After applying specialized vitamin B-12 eye drops, the doctor shines a specific type of ultraviolet light directly onto your cornea to activate the eye drops and trigger the crosslinking., parent_class=MedicalProcedure

disambiguatingDescription[TOK_Q_DELIM]Re.query: prop=disambiguatingDescription, value=Refractive lens exchange (RLE) replaces your eye\'s clear natural lens with an artificial intraocular lens (IOL) to correct your refractive error and achieve sharper focus, reducing your need for reading glasses or bifocals., parent_class=MedicalProcedure

disambiguatingDescription[TOK_Q_DELIM]LA.query: prop=disambiguatingDescription, value=LASIK is a refractive surgery where a laser is used to reshape the inner cornea and restore or correct vision. Patients who otherwise rely on glasses or contact lenses to see can reduce or eliminate the need for these devices after the procedure., parent_class=MedicalProcedure

disambiguatingDescription[TOK_Q_DELIM]We.query: prop=disambiguatingDescription, value=We offer various basic and premium Advanced Lens Implants or Intraocular Lenses (IOLs) that can be customized to suit your specific condition and lifestyle to treat different types of vision problems., parent_class=MedicalProcedure

disambiguatingDescription[TOK_Q_DELIM]Co.query: prop=disambiguatingDescription, value=Contact lenses are prescription devices to correct vision impairments and are an alternative to eyeglasses., parent_class=MedicalProcedure

prop=disambiguatingDescription, value=Corneal collagen crosslinking is a minimally invasive procedure that treats keratoconus, a condition in which the cornea gets progressively thinner and weaker., parent_class=MedicalProcedure

howPerformed[TOK_Q_DELIM]A laser creates.query: prop=howPerformed, value=A laser creates a pocket in the first few layers of the cornea and then the lens is placed in the pocket and centered over the pupil. Only one eye is treated., parent_class=MedicalProcedure

disambiguatingDescription[TOK_Q_DELIM]A.query: prop=disambiguatingDescription, value=A cornea transplant is a surgical procedure that replaces diseased or scarred corneal tissue with healthy tissue from an organ donor., parent_class=MedicalProcedure

howPerformed[TOK_Q_DELIM]The clouded len.query: prop=howPerformed, value=The clouded lens is removed, and a clear artificial lens is usually implanted. In some cases, however, a cataract may be removed without implanting an artificial lens., parent_class=MedicalProcedure
